  • Exodus 40
1 And unto Moses She said: 'Come up unto the Domina, thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship ye afar off; 2 and Moses alone shall come near unto the Domina; but they shall not come near; neither shall the people go up with her.' 3 And Moses came and told the people all the words of the Domina, and all the ordinances; and all the people answered with one voice, and said: 'All the words which the Domina hath spoken will we do.' 4 And Moses wrote all the words of the Domina, and rose up early in the morning, and builded an altar under the mount, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel. 5 And she sent the young women of the children of Israel, who offered burnt-offerings, and sacrificed peace-offerings of oxen unto the Domina. 6 And Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basins; and half of the blood she dashed against the altar. 7 And she took the book of the covenant, and read in the hearing of the people; and they said: 'All that the Domina hath spoken will we do, and obey.' 8 And Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said: 'Behold the blood of the covenant, which the Domina hath made with you in agreement with all these words.' 9 Then went up Moses, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel;
10 and they saw the God of Israel; and there was under Her feet the like of a paved work of sapphire stone, and the like of the very heaven for clearness. 11 And upon the nobles of the children of Israel She laid not Her hand; and they beheld God, and did eat and drink.   12 And the Domina said unto Moses: 'Come up to Me into the mount and be there; and I will give thee the tables of stone, and the law and the commandment, which I have written, that thou mayest teach them.' 13 And Moses rose up, and Joshua her minister; and Moses went up into the mount of God. 14 And unto the elders she said: 'Tarry ye here for us, until we come back unto you; and, behold, Aaron and Hur are with you; whosoever hath a cause, let her come near unto them.' 15 And Moses went up into the mount, and the cloud covered the mount. 16 And the glory of the Domina abode upon mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days; and the seventh day She called unto Moses out of the midst of the cloud. 17 And the appearance of the glory of the Domina was like devouring fire on the top of the mount in the eyes of the children of Israel. 18 And Moses entered into the midst of the cloud, and went up into the mount; and Moses was in the mount forty days and forty nights.
